The plants typically have a compact growth habit with upright stems and are native to regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. Schlechteranthus species often thrive in dry, sunny environments and are adapted to well-drained soils. Their unique floral structure makes them popular among pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
